```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(ggplot2)
```

Testing out my function
```{r}
#For power at 31752 kg
a_light <- power_gen_new(c_rolling, 31752, g=9.8, V=(c(30,22.22,33.33,11.11, 1.389)), 16, p_air=1.2, c_drag=0.3)
a_light

#For power at 31752 kg
a_heavy <- power_gen_new(c_rolling, 15000, g=9.8, V=(c(30,22.22,33.33,11.11, 1.389)), 16, p_air=1.2, c_drag=0.3)
a_heavy

V=c(30,22.22,33.33,11.11, 1.389)

newframe <- data.frame(cbind(V, a_heavy, a_light))

ggplot(data = newframe, aes(x=V, y =a_heavy)) +
  geom_line() +
  geom_line(aes(x=V, y =a_light)) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("a_heavy" = "red", "a_light" = "green"))+
  labs(title = "Power Generation from a Heavy vs Light Truck", y = "Power Generated in Watts", x = "Vehicle speed (assuming no headwind) in m/s (or mps)")

```
